column1: We live in a fantasy world, a world of illusion. The great task in life is to find reality. But given the state of the world, is it wise?
The moment you doubt whether you can fly, you cease forever to be able to do it.
Fantasy mirrors desire. Imagination reshapes it.
Your mind doesn’t know the difference between reality and fantasy. Your mind acts on what you feed it. Feed it good thoughts.
If you don’t turn your life into a fantasy story, you just become a part of someone else’s fantasy story.
column3: The Amazing Maurice and His Educated Rodents

column1: Peter did not feel very brave; indeed, he felt he was going to be sick. But that made no difference to what he had to do.
column3: The Chronicles of Narnia: The Lion, the Witch, and the Wardrobe

column1: Even the smallest person can change the course of history.
column3: Lord of the Rings: The Fellowship of the Ring

column1: “Begin at the beginning,” the King said, very gravely, “and go in till you come to the end: then stop."
There is nothing like looking, if you want to find something. You certainly usually find something, if you look, but it is not always quite the something you were after.
If you can dream it, you can do it.
Imagination is everything. It is the preview of life’s coming attractions.
Do not meddle in the affairs of wizards, for they are subtle and quick to anger.
column3: Lord of the Rings: The Ring Sets Out

column1: Fairy tales are more than true not because they tell us that dragons exist but because they tell us that dragons can be beaten.
All the world is made of faith, and trust, and pixie dust.
The flower that blooms in adversity is the most rare and beautiful of all.
Don't just fly, soar.
Today is a good day to try.
You must unlearn what you have learned…No! Try not. Do. Or do not. There is no try.
column3: Star Wars Episode V: The Empire Strikes Back 1980

column1: It’s not safe out here. It’s wondrous, with treasures to satiate desires both subtle and gross; but it’s not for the timid.
Invention, my dear friends, is 93% perspiration, 6% electricity, 4% evaporation, and 2% butterscotch ripple.
